title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9 - 8 - 7 - 6 points: STRONGER

ESSAYS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES WITH VARYING DEGREES OF EFFECTIVENESS.

  1. Has a clear, well-developed thesis (may be presented and developed in the course of the essay).

  2. Is well-organized (e.g., divides the documents into a variety of response groups or other logical patterns).

  3. Makes apt use of most documents, (implicitly or explicity; "most" means more than half of the documents).

  4. Analyzes more than describes; e.g., discusses sources' reliability and point of view, groups documents appropriately, refers to historical context.

  5. May contain minor errors (i.e., misinterpretation of a document); even a 9 need not be flawless. penalized.

5 - 4 points: MIXED

THESE SCORES SHOULD BE ASSIGNED JUDICIOUSLY. (Don't use as a dumping ground.)

  1. Contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic.

  2. Addresses documents unevenly (e.g., excessive attention to cause and/or effect issues); makes appropriate use of some documents.

  3. Offers limited analysis, e.g., of sources' reliability and point of view, some grouping of documents.

  4. May contain errors, factual and/or interpretive.

3 - 2 - 1 - 0 points: WEAKER

ESSAYS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES WITH VARYING DEGREES OF EFFECTIVENESS. ESSAYS SCORED 0 OR 1 MAY ATTEMPT TO ADDRESS THE QUESTION BUT FAIL TO DO SO.

  1. Thesis confused, unfocused, absent, or simply restates question.

  2. Superficial discussion or listing of documents with_ little or no analysis (laundry list), or no reference to documents.

  3. May contain major errors.

-- NON-RESPONSIVE
Response totally off-task, absent, or irrelevant.
